timeline.subject: Mengeotte Le Compaing
timeline.details: Preliminary investigation begins; witnesses testify to reputation

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Le Compaing
timeline.details: First interrogation; accused denies all charges

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Le Compaing
timeline.details: Torture session with thumbscrews and rack; continued to deny

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Le Compaing
timeline.details: Rémy proposes that she be released (renvoyée)

timeline.subject: Mengeotte Le Compaing
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to release

methods: cords twisted around arms and legs

prior_accusations.context: Told Claude Mabrey's son-in-law that there was one unmarried witch who had long pursued him, plus four others trying to kill him

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: Mangez, mangez, vous doubtez bien de mourir
notable_quotes.english: Eat, eat, you really fear dying
notable_quotes.context: Said to Valentin when serving suspicious food

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle faisoit de son doeul joye, et qu'on luy faisoit tort
notable_quotes.english: that she made joy of her grief, and that they wronged her
notable_quotes.context: Response when called a witch by her employer

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: nous ne reverrons plus notre petitte Jehennon elle sera morte et enterrée a notre retour
notable_quotes.english: we will not see our little Jehennon again, she will be dead and buried when we return
notable_quotes.context: Said to Mengeon on morning of child's sickness as they went to plough

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: que si elle avoit ung homme a marit la voulant croire et qu'elle phut avoir deux vaches ilz se nourriroient sans danger d'aultruy
notable_quotes.english: that if she had a husband willing to trust her and if she could have two cows they would sustain themselves without danger from others
notable_quotes.context: Said to Jean Bastien Jehandel when he was looking for a wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: que le diable luy fust ez mains
notable_quotes.english: may the devil be in his hands
notable_quotes.context: Cursed Jean Bastien Jehandel after he took an apple from her tree

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: que son fils avoit bien des escus pour la faire brusler, mais que de luy ne d'autres n'en viendroit au bout et qu'il payast ses debtes
notable_quotes.english: that her son had plenty of money to have her burned, but that neither he nor others would succeed in this and that he should pay his debts
notable_quotes.context: Said to Claudette veuve Bastien Jehandel about her son

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle auroit eust ung meschant coeur au ventre de faire mourir ung si plaisant enffant
notable_quotes.english: that she would have had a wicked heart in her belly to kill such a pleasant child
notable_quotes.context: Response when reproached for death of Nicolas Petit Didier's daughter

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte Le Compaing
notable_quotes.french: elle leur monstreroit ung tour qu'ilz ne savoient pas
notable_quotes.english: she would show them a trick they didn't know
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Anthoine Claude Anthoine's children after dispute about straying animals

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of late Didier le Compain of Develine
lived with mother and brother some 6 years, then lived with brother for last 9 years, looking after children since he was widower
had been in his service for 3 or 4 years
both been in service with Nicolas Petit Didier
her daughter Laurence found an object in soup
husband and wife both testify, witness 3 and witness 8
His brother-in-law Jean, son of maire Bastien
fellow servants in house of Colas Petit Didier
neighbors in Develine with land disputes

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes mentioned: George Ferry quarreled over a field; Jean Bastien Jehandel threatened with 'pay his debts'; dispute over hay purchase; dispute over sharpening stone and cherries taken from field; dispute over piglets; witness noted accused said Jean Bastien had money to prosecute her. Accused proposed marriage arrangement based on having 'two cows' for economic security.

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill for a week after eating beans
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: angry because meal not ready when he wanted to go to woods

harms_catalog.harm_description: child cried for drink, then cried more than ever, died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused complained when sent to fetch drink for sick child
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity/witchcraft after rocking child in cradle

harms_catalog.harm_description: slight leg injury became swollen and very painful
born 6 or 7 weeks prematurely, which died
fever, bad hand for 3 weeks, bad neck, teeth clenched so tightly had to be fed on milk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: took an apple from her tree
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curse: 'que le diable luy fust ez mains'

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick and expected to die, then began to eat and get better after public accusation
lost her milk
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (reversed when he sought her help)

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill after asking for drink, died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: child asked Mengeotte to rock her, accused complained about fetching drink

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost milk, but recovered after he took 'joutte' from her garden and gave it to cow
died next day after straying into her garden
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: goat strayed into her garden, she was angry, witness called her witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk (happened 4 times in all)
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after eating cooked joutte given by accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: baby died after witness lost milk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: none - accused loved the child too much

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick, then made straight for Mengeotte's house after devin remedy, died as if rabid
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (devin test pointed to her house)

harms_catalog.harm_description: died within 3 or 4 days after being fed hay
became very ill, all swollen for 7 weeks, judged to be dying, voided 'beaucoup de mal et putrefaction'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: took her place in service at Christmas

harms_catalog.harm_description: swelling in throat, after bathing it burst in his mouth
premature birth and death
death of calf
stepped on cat, premature birth of child and illness which lasted 7 weeks, felt she had animals in stomach
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: saw accused in front of house at St Jean, wife was frightened

harms_catalog.harm_description: death of goat
died suddenly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband found sharpening stone under cherry-tree (showing they took cherries) and did not return it
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after theft of cherries and non-return of stone

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: agreed Mengeotte should have 2 piglets, but sold them elsewhere when she didn't collect them

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened and later died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: his wife chased brother's animals out of field and told off children
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat: 'elle leur monstreroit ung tour qu'ilz ne savoient pas'

plate of cabbage soup with suspicious red object the size of a large nut
object found in soup that seemed made of compacted hairs

took from her garden at night and gave to cow as counter-magic

used with holy water as remedy from devin
bought hay for 3 gros and a small cheese, calf fed it died

belonged to accused's brother, found under cherry-tree

taken from Pierat Jean Pierat's cherry-tree

making butter from her cow, claimed to make 15 pounds in a fortnight
young men playing throwing water at one another from a bucket

asked 3 gros for hay

historical_context.military_details: Claude Mabrey's son-in-law came back ill from war, all swollen. Document ends with list of executions carried out by prevot in 1593, several soldiers involved in homicides.
economic_hardship_indicators: Mengeotte proposed marriage arrangement based on economic security with two cows
References to debts - accused told Jean Bastien's mother 'qu'il payast ses debtes'
Pieron Jean Pierat lost animals worth 100 ecus over 10-12 years
Economic disputes over hay, cheese, piglets, field access
religious_calendar_references: Christmas (when Poline took accused's place in service)

hearsay_chains.content: as they went out to plough on morning of child's sickness she had said 'nous ne reverrons plus notre petitte Jehennon elle sera morte et enterrée a notre retour'
that Bastien's wife went to dances too often

hearsay_chains.source: brother-in-law Jean, son of maire Bastien
hearsay_chains.content: told of going into kitchen and finding Mengeotte with hair spread, rubbing something on face, fire flaring up

emotional_state_notes: cried when accused of killing child
sometimes cried when called witch, sometimes said 'qu'elle faisoit de son doeul joye, et qu'on luy faisoit tort'
denied all charges during interrogation and torture

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: No specific reproaches, but said she took them for what they were, then said they had lied

third_parties.context: mother's reputation as witch; multiple witnesses mention mother also reputed witch; lived with accused after father's death

third_parties.name: Mengeotte's brother
third_parties.context: widower whose children accused looked after for 9 years; heard Jean Bastien accuse her of bewitching bull; said he would eat his words but took no action; animals strayed into Anthoine's field

third_parties.name: Claude Mabrey's son-in-law

third_parties.context: Mengeotte was in his service when found in kitchen with hair spread

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkably detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony. The case is notable because Mengeotte was RELEASED despite: (1) strong reputation evidence spanning 6-10 years, (2) 21 witnesses, (3) numerous alleged harms including multiple child deaths and animal deaths, (4) threatening quotes in French, (5) consultation with devins pointing to her, (6) her mother's prior reputation as witch. She maintained her denials throughout torture (thumbscrews, rack twice, cords around limbs) and was ultimately released (renvoyée). This represents a significant acquittal in the Lorraine trials. Key patterns: food/soup poisoning allegations, loss of milk (nursing mothers), premature births/child deaths, animal deaths following quarrels, economic disputes (fields, hay, piglets, cherries), and use of counter-magic (taking joutte from garden). The trial shows standard Lorraine procedure: informations preparatoires, interrogation, confrontations, torture request by Rémy, approval by Change de Nancy, torture session, then release proposal and approval.
